p:
In conclusion the 2017â€“2018 influenza season in Catalonia was, as in the rest of Spain,
10 an unusual epidemic season with an early onset, great predominance of influenza B (Yamagata strain) virus circulation followed by a second wave of influenza A (subtypes H3N2 and (H1N1)pdm09) that resulted in a high hospitalization rate of severe cases especially among the elderly. The low vaccine coverage among >64 age group stresses the need to upgrade vaccine uptake in this age group as well as in those of any age with a risk factor for presenting influenza related complications.
